case_vignette: A 12-year-old boy presents with right flank pain and hematuria. His older brother has had several similar episodes in the past. Results of microscopic urinalysis are shown in Figure A.
question: Which  tests can be used to help confirm the underlying diagnosis?

I've been having pain on my right side, near the back, and I noticed blood in my urine.
Have you had any history of kidney stones or urinary tract infections?

No, I haven't been taking any medications.

No, my appetite and weight have been normal.

No, I haven't noticed any changes in my energy or how I sleep.

Have you noticed any changes in your overall health or well-being?
No, just the pain and the blood in my urine.
Final Diagnosis: Hematuria (blood in urine)
